commText: de Kock and Rahul are at the crease. de Kock is on strike. Boult will open the attack
Boult to de Kock, no run, length delivery, outside off, curls away, de Kock stabs the ball down into the off-side. Just couldn't time it

Boult to de Kock, FOUR, wow! Boult looks for some swing by pitching it up. Was a low full toss in the end and de Kock just stroked it down the ground and got it back past the bowler for a four. Presented the full face of the bat to get it away
Boult to de Kock, no run, short, wide, de Kock chops the ball down and finds the man at point. Was hit well off the back foot but ended up finding the fielder at point. Was timed very well
Boult to de Kock, no run, back of a length delivery, outside off, de Kock stands tall and pats it down into the off-side to find cover
Boult to de Kock, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Boult to de Kock, out Caught by Nandre Burger!! Boult would have taken many wickets with the new ball but has to be one of the luckiest for sure. Easy take for the Impact sub - Burger - who takes it with elan. Was a poor delivery on the pads, de Kock whipped it and found the hands of the man at long leg. A little to the left or right and it would have been a boundary but not to be. de Kock is distraught and has to walk off. de Kock c Nandre Burger b Boult 4(5) [4s-1]
Devdutt Padikkal, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Boult to Padikkal, no run, dot ball to end the over. Keeps a little low, decks in, Padikkal gets behind the line of the delivery and stabs it out into the off-side
Nandre Burger, left-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Nandre Burger to Rahul, no run, short of length delivery, angled across, Rahul stands tall and looks to punch it. Gets an inside edge and gets it down to the keeper. The timing wasn't there
The bowler loses his run-up. The batter wasn't ready I guess.
Nandre Burger to Rahul, no run, another dot. Pats the length delivery and finds the man at cover. Was a length delivery angled across
Nandre Burger to Rahul, no run, short ball, Rahul looks to pull and mistimes it down to mid-on. The ball got big on the batter
Nandre Burger to Rahul, leg byes, FOUR, poor delivery, on the pads, Rahul looks to clip and misses. The ball went off the pads and went fine for four leg byes

Nandre Burger to Rahul, 2 runs, back of a length delivery, Rahul gets on top of the ball and stabs it down wide of third man for a brace. That was played with soft hands by Rahul as he kept the ball down

Nandre Burger to Rahul, no run, length delivery, Rahul pushes the delivery down to mid-on as the ball angled across a little. Nandre Burger is clocking almost 150 clicks. He is bowling at top speeds and will be a challenge for both the batters

Boult to Padikkal, no run, the concussion protocol will happen now. The neck guard has flown away. Was a short ball and Padikkal missed the delivery to be hit flush on the grille. A new helmet is out. That was banged in short, Padikkal looked to pull and took his eyes off I guess to be hit on the helmet. The impact was such that the neck guard went flying. He is good to carry on
Boult to Padikkal, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

Boult to Padikkal, out Bowled!! What happened there? The batter still reeling from the last ball? Was a length delivery, skidded on and Padikkal didn't move his feet and wanted to pull it but missed to be clean bowled. The feet were stuck in cement and his first outing in LSG shirt has ended on a poor note. The perfume ball almost had him floored earlier and now the length delivery has done its job. He was stuck on the back foot. Second strike for Boult and RR are off to a superb start here. Padikkal b Boult 0(3)
Ayush Badoni, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Boult to Ayush Badoni, no run, 140 clicks from Boult! Goes round the wicket and angles it in. Ayush Badoni sees the line and lets it go to the keeper
Boult to Ayush Badoni, no run, length delivery at 132.8 clicks, Ayush Badoni gets a stride out and pats it down into the off-side

Boult to Ayush Badoni, no run, Boult stringing some dot balls. Hasn't given a run away in this over. Seemed like a slower one and Ayush Badoni was drawn into a drive. The checked drive went to the man at cover on a few bounces. The speed gun showed almost 135 clicks
Boult to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, angles the slower one on the pads at 116 clicks, Ayush Badoni clips it off the pads for a single. End of a superb testing over from Boult
STAT: Trent Boult has taken 23 wickets in the first over of an innings in IPL since 2020 - no other bowler has taken more than eight. 55 overs 23 wickets Avg 12.17 ER 5.09 SR 14.3
Nandre Burger to Ayush Badoni, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Nandre Burger to Ayush Badoni, out Caught by Buttler!! Burger has his first scalp in IPL 2024. The ball bowled at 147.2 clicks and Ayush Badoni looked to drive it on the up. The bat face turned a little on impact and he spooned an easy catch to the man at mid-off. Buttler won't drop those. Third one down for LSG and RR on top here. Ayush Badoni c Buttler b Nandre Burger 1(5)
Deepak Hooda, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Nandre Burger to Hooda, no run, angles a length delivery on the pads, nudged down on to the on-side
Nandre Burger to Hooda, SIX, uses the pace and just steers it over third man. Was a short ball, angled across, Hooda waited on it and just opened the face of the bat to get it away
Nandre Burger to Hooda, FOUR, slower delivery at 128.7 clicks, Hooda was caught between two stools and somehow managed to get it over the cordon for a four
Nandre Burger to Hooda, 1 run, on the pads, at 145 clicks, Hooda tucks it off the pads for a single to deep square
Nandre Burger to Rahul, no run, 142.4 kph. Rahul stands tall and punches it wide of point. They get a single. Got on top of the ball and punched it but the fielder did well to stop it
Boult to Hooda, FOUR, back of a length delivery, outside off, Hooda stands tall and punches it wide of the man at cover point. The fielder dived over it and four more
Boult to Hooda, 1 run, gets it down down to mid-on for a single. The ball angled in, Hooda stabbed it down and ran off. Quick single nabbed

Boult to Rahul, no run, Rahul gets hit on the helmet as well. Hits him on the side of the helmet. Was a short ball, Rahul looked to pull and was late on it. The batter just couldn't account for the extra bounce. Boult had his hands up immediately

Boult to Rahul, FOUR, four more. Rahul wasn't going to fall for the bait. He rather took on the bait and slammed it over cover. Got under the fuller ball and slammed it on the up. Was a slower one I guess
Boult to Rahul, no run, back of a length delivery at 134 kph. Rahul punches the ball down to cover
Boult to Rahul, 1 run, gets it down to deep cover for a single as that was a length delivery outside off. That was bowled from round the wicket and Rahul managed to punch it away
Ravichandran Ashwin, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
Ashwin to Rahul, 5 wides, starts with a quicker one, down leg, Rahul looked to sweep and missed it. Has been wided and 5 runs to the tally
Ashwin to Rahul, SIX, and sixer. Massive hit. Was a tossed up delivery, on the pads, Rahul sits down and slams the slog sweep over deep backward square for a sixer. Well hit by Rahul
Ashwin to Rahul, 1 run, flatter one, quicker, tucked down to deep mid for a single
Ashwin to Hooda, 1 run, goes back and works it wide of long-on for a single
Ashwin to Rahul, no run, shorter, wider, Rahul throws his bat at it and slashes it down to find cover point
Ashwin to Rahul, 1 run, slower one, Rahul gets down the track and punches it down to long-on for a single
Ashwin to Hooda, 1 run, flatter one, Hooda tucks it wide of long-on for a single. That spun in and Hooda played it off the back foot
Deepak Hooda has surpassed his highest score of 17 across 12 innings in IPL 2023

Powerplay summary -- Boult and Burger dismantle LSG top-order -- De Kock hits a loose ball straight to the fielder (0.5) -- Padikkal is clean bowled for a duck (2.2) -- Badoni caught at mid-off off Burger (3.1) -- Ashwin's first over goes for 15
Avesh Khan, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Avesh Khan to Hooda, 1 run, length ball just outside off, Hooda gets forward and punches it through cover
Avesh Khan to Rahul, 1 run, 132.3kph, short of length on off, Rahul looks to pull but is late on the shot. Mistimes it off the splice to long-on
Avesh Khan to Hooda, SIX, short of length on off, slower one at 119kph, and it sits up beautifully for Hooda. He spots the variation and whacks it over midwicket. He's off to a flier here
Avesh Khan to Hooda, 1 run, 133.4kph, back of a length delivery outside off, Hooda cuts nicely but is denied by a diving stop at backward point
Avesh Khan to Rahul, 1 run, banged in short around off, gets up to shoulder height, Rahul mistimes the pull to midwicket
Avesh Khan to Hooda, no run, 134.3kph, overpitched outside off, Hooda goes for the drive but finds short cover

Timeout! Good counter-attack so far from Hooda who came in when the score was 11/3. With some luck on his side, he's raced to 26 off just 12 balls to get LSG back in the hunt. Will be a test now against Chahal though. He should get the ball to grip here.
Yuzvendra Chahal, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack
Chahal to Rahul, 2 runs, starts with a quick one at 94kph. It's a full ball on middle, Rahul gets forward and punches it firmly down the ground. Takes a tumbling stop from long-on to his left

Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, oh dear there's a mix-up and Hooda could've been in trouble with a more accurate throw! Flat length ball on middle and leg, Rahul tucks it off the back foot through midwicket and is never looking for two. Hooda, though, decides to go for it and is halfway down when he turns back. Throw isn't great to Samson
Chahal to Hooda, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Chahal to Hooda, out Caught by Dhruv Jurel!! Steps out to Chahal first ball, and perishes. Didn't even have a look at him first before wanting to send him out of the park. It's pushed through at 98kph, Hooda is nowhere close to the pitch of it, goes through with the slog and drags it off the inside half to deep midwicket. Hooda c Dhruv Jurel b Chahal 26(13) [4s-2 6s-2]
Nicholas Pooran, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Chahal to Pooran, no run, googly first ball to Pooran, he defends from the crease
Chahal to Pooran, wide, another flat googly outside off, turning away off a length, Pooran is caught in the crease in defence and gets a thick edge into the off-side
Chahal to Pooran, no run, flat length ball outside off, Pooran defends from the crease
Chahal to Pooran, no run, slightly slower outside off, makes Pooran reach out for the drive and he slices it to backward point
Avesh Khan to Rahul, 1 run, 135.5kph length ball just outside off, Rahul drives on the up to deep point
Avesh Khan to Pooran, 1 run, 140kph short ball around the head, Pooran mistimes the pull to deep midwicket
Avesh Khan to Rahul, 1 run, 135.5kph short of length delivery on off, just above the waist, Rahul pulls nicely to the right of deep midwicket. Just a single as the fielder gets to it quickly
Avesh Khan to Pooran, no run, 137kph yorker on off, Pooran squeezes it down the pitch
Avesh Khan to Pooran, 1 run, short ball slanted in from round the wicket, Pooran gets on top of the bounce and pulls it through square leg
Avesh Khan to Rahul, 1 run, 135.5kph, pitched up on off, Rahul gets forward and punches firmly to the left of long-on
Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, 96.7kph, pushed through flat on leg stump, sliding on from back of a length. Rahul goes back and clips it to deep midwicket
Chahal to Pooran, 1 run, 90.6kph, bowls the googly quite wide outside off, Pooran reaches out and drives to deep point
Chahal to Rahul, no run, flat length ball on off, Rahul hangs back and punches to extra cover
Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, Rahul is batting at a run-a-ball and not taking chances. Leaving it to Pooran. It's a legbreak tossed up on middle and leg, he works it through midwicket

Chahal to Pooran, SIX, again Chahal looks to bowl it wide outside off to Pooran, it's fairly full at close to 95kph, but this time it's not wide enough. Pooran reaches out and launches it down the ground. The ball is hit into the wind so it barely clears the ropes. The fielder at long-off even tries jumping outside the boundary to flick it back but fails
Chahal to Pooran, 1 run, flat length ball quite wide outside off, Pooran drives wide of cover
Over Summary (6-10): -- Rahul smashes Avesh for a sixer -- Chahal removes Hooda in his first over -- Avesh bowls a quiet second over -- Pooran goes after Chahal and hits him for a six
Nandre Burger [2.0-0-13-1] is back into the attack
Nandre Burger to Pooran, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off, 141kph, Pooran dabs it to deep third
Nandre Burger to Rahul, 1 run, slower short ball outside off, Rahul pulls gently through square leg
Nandre Burger to Pooran, 1 run, slower one floated up outside off, Pooran looks to drive but mistimes it off the inside half to long-on

Nandre Burger to Rahul, SIX, Rahul chances his arm this time, and gets six! 139.7kph length ball slanted in around off, Rahul keeps a steady base in the crease and slogs it over midwicket, making good contact. With the rate rising, the LSG captain has decided to raise the tempo, and rightly so

Nandre Burger to Rahul, FOUR, slower length ball on off, and Rahul gets four more as he lofts it over mid-off! Both mid-off and mid-on were in the ring, and even though Rahul was slightly early through the shot, he got enough on it

Nandre Burger to Rahul, FOUR, 14 off the last three balls! Just the kind of switch in momentum LSG were after. Slower short ball around off, Rahul arches back, gets under it and ramps it over the keeper
Ravichandran Ashwin [1.0-0-15-0] is back into the attack

Ashwin to Pooran, 1 run, 102.3kph, length ball darted in on off stump from round the wicket, Pooran hangs back and punches gently to cover. He goes for a tight single and a direct hit could've been close
Ashwin to Rahul, 1 run, 93kph pushed through full around off, Rahul gets forward and knocks it to long-on
Ashwin to Pooran, 1 run, 99.7kph full outside off, Pooran stretches forward and knocks it wide of cover

Ashwin to Rahul, FOUR, oh he exposes the stumps by walking across them, gets a carrom ball on middle and leg, and sweeps it away quite fine. He's really turning it on here. Has scored 19 off his last 5 balls
Ashwin to Rahul, 1 run, carrom ball at the stumps, Rahul tucks it behind square
Ashwin to Pooran, 1 run, fired in full on off, 99kph, Pooran squeezes it wide of cover
The required rate is well within reach thanks to the surge of momentum in these last couple of overs. Rahul is starting to turn it on
Trent Boult [3.0-0-15-2] is back into the attack
Boult to Pooran, 1 run, slower short ball outside off, Pooran swats it to long-on
Boult to Rahul, 1 run, miscue from Rahul but he escapes! Full and wide outside off, he throws his hands at it and ends up slicing it off the outside half. It falls well short of deep point
Boult to Pooran, SIX, absolutely spanked! Slower short ball outside off, Pooran goes after it and slaps it over point. It goes like a rocket over the ropes
Boult to Pooran, FOUR, boundaries are flowing here! Low full toss outside off, Pooran reaches out and drives nicely through extra cover. Things are getting out of control for RR
Boult to Pooran, SIX, another full toss, and this goes the distance! 18 off the over already with a ball to go. Line is on middle and off, Pooran swings hard, gets hold and tonks it over wide long-on
Boult to Pooran, 2 runs, slower short ball outside off, Pooran fetches it and drags the pull through the gap at midwicket for two more
Just over 10 per over needed now. RR desperately need a breakthrough
Ashwin to Rahul, 2 runs, carrom ball outside off, turning away off a length, Rahul walks across and sweeps behind square. He places it in the gap and gets back for two
Ashwin to Rahul, 1 run, length delivery on off, carrom ball again, Rahul gets forward and knocks it to long-on. Starts the season with a fifty
Most sixes in T20s since IPL 2023 113* N Pooran 89 H Klaasen 88 A Russell 80 W Jacks 76 G Maxwell Sixth 50+ score in 14 innings vs Royals for KL Rahul

Ashwin to Pooran, no run, slightly slower at 91kph, drifting in from round the wicket. Pooran looks to work it through midwicket but it slides past the inside edge to hit the pad. Would've easily missed leg stump
Ashwin to Pooran, 1 run, drifting into the pads, Pooran works it through midwicket
Ashwin to Rahul, 2 runs, carrom ball on middle, Rahul gets low and sweeps through square leg. THey get back for two and Ashwin isn't happy with the fielder there. Gives him a stare in frustration
Ashwin to Rahul, 1 run, length delivery on middle, carrom ball, Rahul punches it in the air but it's out of Ashwin's reach as he sticks his right hand out. Goes to long-on for a single
Sandeep Sharma, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, 1 run, 120kph length ball outside off, Rahul plays late and cuts it quite fine but fails to beat short third. It goes on the bounce to the fielder who misfields
This is Sandeep Sharma's first over. He has been saved for the death overs
Sandeep Sharma to Pooran, 1 run, slower bouncer which has good height on it. Pooran mistimes the pull through square leg
Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, 1 run, direct hit would've sent Rahul packing! Length ball outside off, Rahul chops it to extra cover and takes off for a very risky run. He would've been well short
Sandeep Sharma to Pooran, 1 run, yorker on middle, 118kph, Pooran squeezes it to long-on

Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, no run, there's a big noise as ball goes past bat but absolutely no appeal. Not sure what it was. Length ball wide of off, Rahul goes very hard looking to cut it away but misses by a long way
Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, 1 run, 121kph back of a length delivery wide of off, Rahul cuts it to sweeper cover. Excellent over from Sandeep, just five singles off it

Over Summary (11-15): -- Rahul takes Burger on and hits him for two fours and a six -- Rahul goes after Ashwin as well -- Pooran hits Boult for two sixes and a four -- Rahul notches up his fifty -- Rahul survives a run-out scare -- LSG need 60 off 30 balls
The rate, which was close to 10, has gone up to 12 after two quiet overs. Big over now as Chahal is brought back
Yuzvendra Chahal [2.0-0-14-1] is back into the attack

Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, outstanding work in the deep! It looked four for all money, but Parag quickly gets around and slaps it back into the field of play. Rahul is also taken by surprise. He dances down and hits it powerfully down the ground, expects it to go for four and doesn't run hard. Eventually gets just one
Chahal to Pooran, SIX, his plan to Pooran has been to bowl quite wide. Does the same again here. But Pooran is so powerful. He reaches out and launches it over the long-on boundary
Chahal to Pooran, 2 runs, well wide outside off, Pooran throws his hands at it and slices it over extra cover. Hasn't got proper hold for it, so it's cut off in the deep
Chahal to Pooran, no run, goes for a reverse-hit this time knowing that Chahal is going to go wide. Misses it completely
Chahal to Pooran, 1 run, length ball wide of off, Pooran slaps it hard but straight to long-off. That fielder is placed straighter than usual
Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, pushed through at 104kph, length ball on leg stump, Rahul goes back and tucks it behind square

Timeout! Decent recovery there from Chahal after going for six early in the over. However, these two LSG batters are looking quite dangerous. After taking some time initially to rebuild, both Rahul and Pooran are striking it beautifully out there. Can Sandeep be the trump card for Royals? They've put a lot of faith in him, saving his overs for the death and his first over was brilliant too.
Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, out Caught by Dhruv Jurel!! Sandeep Sharma, you beauty! Entrusted with the responsibility of bowling these critical overs, he's doing a stellar job so far, and has now delivered the big wicket of Rahul. Full and wide outside off, Rahul shuffles across to reach out and throws his bat at it. But he miscues it off the outside half and Jurel takes it safely at sweeper cover. Rahul c Dhruv Jurel b Sandeep Sharma 58(44) [4s-4 6s-2]
Marcus Stoinis, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Sandeep Sharma to Stoinis, 1 run, 124kph back of a length outside off, Stoinis punches it to sweeper cover
Sandeep Sharma to Pooran, 1 run, slower bouncer at the head, Pooran pulls to deep backward square
Sandeep Sharma to Stoinis, 1 run, 122kph length ball wide of off, Stoinis reaches out and cuts nicely through backward point. Chance for two? No they settle for the single
Sandeep Sharma to Pooran, no run, brilliant stuff from Sandeep! Slower short ball outside off, deceives Pooran who is through the pull early and misses completely

Sandeep Sharma to Pooran, FOUR, didn't seem to have timed this one very well, but still gets a boundary! Much needed one for LSG after a quiet over so far. Slower short ball again, Pooran pulls through midwicket and finds the gap to perfection. It's fifty for him off just 30 balls!
With Rahul out of the way, Samson goes to Ashwin again
Ravichandran Ashwin [3.0-0-31-0] is back into the attack
Ashwin to Stoinis, 1 run, carrom ball on middle, pushed through on a good length, Stoinis hangs back and punches to long-on

Ashwin to Pooran, 1 run, big shout for LBW as Pooran misses the sweep, but it's turned down by the umpire. Royals not interested in a review either. Impact might've been outside off. Carrom ball darted in from round the wicket, turns in off a good length and beats Pooran on the sweep
Ashwin to Stoinis, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Ashwin to Stoinis, out Caught by Dhruv Jurel!! Another catch in the deep for Jurel, and Royals are starting to take control of the game. Ashwin gets his first wicket. Carrom ball fired in full on leg stump, Stoinis slogs across the line, doesn't get enough on it and it's straight to deep midwicket. Stoinis c Dhruv Jurel b Ashwin 3(4)
Krunal Pandya, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Ashwin to Krunal Pandya, no run, smartly bowled. It's fired in well wide outside off, away from Pandya's arc, and it turns away further to beat him on the slog-sweep
Ashwin to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, 104kph length ball outside off, Pandya connects with the slog-sweep this time but it goes on the bounce to deep midwicket
Ashwin to Pooran, 1 run, big cry of anguish from Pooran as he doesn't connect properly. Length ball fired in outside off, he looks to slog and drags it off a thick inside edge through midwicket
LSG need 38 off the last two overs. Really difficult ask, especially given the way Sandeep is bowling
Sandeep Sharma to Pooran, wide, slower bouncer from Sandeep, Pooran ducks underneath it and it's called wide for height. Royals challenge the call, but it stays as a wide. Review lost!

Sandeep Sharma to Pooran, 1 run, dropped! Very full on middle, Pooran fails to get under it and miscues the lofted shot in front of long-on. Difficult chance for Parag running in, but having covered the ground so well, he would be disappointed at not grabbing it
Sandeep Sharma to Krunal Pandya, leg byes, 1 run, slower one on middle and leg, back of a length, Pandya looks to slog but is hit on the body
Sandeep Sharma to Pooran, FOUR, goes for the yorker, ends up as a low full toss on the pads and Pooran capitalises. He whacks it through midwicket and finds the gap
Sandeep Sharma to Pooran, no run, Pooran turns down the single! Slower short ball outside off, tries swattng it hard down the ground but fails to beat long-on. Wants to keep the strike
Sandeep Sharma to Pooran, no run, slower bouncer outside off, Pooran looks to pull hard but is deceived by the lack of pace. He's through the shot too early and gets beaten

Sandeep Sharma to Pooran, FOUR, last ball goes for four. Still, it's another superb over from Sandeep given the situation. Goes for a wide yorker outside off, falls a couple of inches short of the mark and Pooran slices it through backward point
Avesh to bowl the last over with LSG needing 27
Avesh Khan [2.0-0-15-0] is back into the attack

Avesh Khan to Krunal Pandya, 2 wides, doesn't execute the plan of bowling a wide yorker properly. It's way too wide outside off, Pandya lets it go and the keeper fumbles, getting Pooran back on strike
Avesh Khan to Pooran, no run, umpire Dharmasena tells Pooran that he moved across the stumps and that's why this isn't a wide. Full toss outside off, Pooran swings and misses
Avesh Khan to Pooran, no run, cracking yorker outside off, Pooran fails to even lay bat on it
Avesh Khan to Pooran, 1 run, 136.8kph low full toss on middle and leg, Pooran looks to slog and mistimes it through midwicket for a single
Avesh Khan to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, back of a length outside off, slower one at 120kph, Pandya chops it wide of cover
Avesh Khan to Pooran, 1 run, short of length outside off, Pooran goes for a reverse-hit and mistimes it to deep backward point
Avesh Khan to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, slower one outside off, back of a length, Pandya cuts to deep point. Royals start their campaign with a win at home

19:25 Local Time, 13:55 GMT, 19:25 IST: Take a bow, Sandeep Sharma! Entrusted with the responsibility of bowling at the death, he emerged as the trump card for Royals to help them start their campaign with a win. He's the first person Samson goes to and gives him a hug. The captain batted beautifully himself earlier in the day, smashing 82 off just 52 balls and took RR to a big score of 193. However, things seemed to be slipping away from them when KL Rahul and Nicholas Pooran were at the crease. Despite a terrible start to the chase as the top order was dismantled by Boult and Burger, LSG managed to launch a brilliant recovery and they were right on top with 65 needed off the last six overs, with Rahul and Pooran at the crease. It was then that Sandeep was introduced in the attack, and he turned the balance completely with an outstanding spell. Might've only got one wicket, but the way he executed his plans under pressure was a treat to watch. He showed everyone exactly why he's been chosen to bowl those difficult overs, and why the management has put so much faith in him. Stay tuned, we'll have the presentations shortly.

Ravichandran Ashwin: I think it was a wicket of two halves, I thought it stuck in the pitch in the first half, it was a bit tacky, it depends on how much water you put on. Sanju and Riyan batted really well, but I felt we were 10 runs short, with so many impact players coming up in the form of Hetmyer and Jurel. But the pitch holds up well over here. I went for 12 off the first two balls, it needs a different mindset, having come from Test cricket. I'm in a good mental and physical space at the moment though. I went for 15 in the 1st over in the powerplay, I bowl 2 or 3 at times, I try to forget it away, it's a different ball game after the powerplay. It depends on who you'll encounter, for eg: I came up against Krunal, Pooran and Stoinis, that's something I hadn't visualised in the 18th over. The game is built by perceptions, if you look at the way Sandy has bowled, he has been a top-5 bowler (in the IPL) - he's a character, does the dirty work for us, did a lot to cover for Prasidh in the last season as well. I see him as a fighter - bowlers getting 2 bouncers is the only fillip in this format and the bowlers are looking to use it. Boulty has performed for a long time and Nandre did well in his 1st game, I see him doing a lot more in the future.

KL Rahul, LSG captain: Bowled well in patches. The target wasn't a lot. We made a few mistakes. Good to see Mohsin back. Naveen has been crucial for us. We will learn from the mistakes. We need to find ways to win games of cricket. Langer has bought a lot of calmness to the group. We enjoy having him around. Missing a season was really painful.

Samson, RR captain and POTM: Always great fun to spend time in the middle. Becomes more special when you win the game. This time I've been given different kind of role with slightly different combination we have. Sanga has given me some suggestions to follow. I've been playing IPL for 10 years - there has to be some experience coming in. I feel I need to spend more time and understand conditions. Playing international ODIs also helped me. It's all about understanding your strengths and weaknesses. I'm a batsman who just reacts to the ball - no matter the first ball or the last ball. I should give this trophy to him (Sandeep). If he didn't bowl those three overs, I wouldn't be POTM. I thought I should call him. I heard Ash bhai say it's not just about skill but character in pressure moments. He has that in his eyes, in his body language that you can trust that guy.

Royals had lost four and won just one match at their home venue last year. They'll hope things are different this time, and it's a good start in that regard. Don't be fooled by the margin of 20 runs, this match was much closer than that and it was Sandeep Sharma's brilliant spell at the death that sealed the deal for Royals. He was assigned the role of bowling the difficult overs, and was introduced in the attack as late as the 15th over. From there, he turned the game around with some lovely execution under pressure. So that's it from this one. The evening game is already underway in Ahmedabad. Join us there. This is Sagar Chawla signing off on behalf of Harish, Kumar Abhisekh Das and Pradeep Krishnamurthy.
